abstract: Federal Magistrate Judge A David Copperthite rules Harold T Martin, National Security Agency intelligence contractor accused of breaching classified information at unprecedented scale, must stay in jail while awaiting trial; defense attorney describes Martin as committed worker with compulsive hoarding problem, while prosecutors paint portrait of serial lawbreaker posing significant flight risk.

keywords.value: Office of the Director of National Intelligence
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: An unlocked garden shed stuffed with classified documents might be a symptom of a mental disorder, a suspect’s lawyer said.
snippet: An unlocked garden shed stuffed with classified documents might be a symptom of a mental disorder, a suspect’s lawyer said....

headline.main: Man Who Took Trove of N.S.A. Data Has Court Date
headline.print_headline: Man Found With Data From N.S.A. Is in Court
